page.title: 11Chesterfield Relief Road
page.content: The Chesterfield Inner Relief Road was opened during the summer of 1985, ten months ahead of schedule.The road cuts across the eastern side of town and follows much of the old Great Central Railway line. The new road has resulted in a decreased & consequently improved traffic flow through the town centre. Residents of Whittington Moor express mixed feelings about the road. Some welcome it because it cuts down journey time and gives easier access to local shops and town centre. Other residents have been upset by compuls- ory moves to new homes resulting from house demolition to make way for the road. Shopkeepers on Sheffield Road have reported a loss of business owing to decreased traffic flow.Many elderly pedestrians have expressed a fear of subways which has virtually isolated them on one side of the road.
